A rough path wanders along a marshy strand between a line of willows and the sluggish river that blocks any progress southward. Slime-worms ooze their gelid way through the thick ooze at your feet as something with a shiny carapace and numerous legs springs out of the ooze to grab one of them and drag it, struggling weakly, back beneath the thin film of water on the mud.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Willow Tree Marsh
node.description: A giant among willows has collapsed here, its foundation undermined by the seeping marsh as it spreads across the once-dry land. Roots pulled free as the tree toppled now stand naked in the air as the dead giant slowly melts into the mud and decay. A thick lacing of moss and less identifiable growths have sprung up along the trunk and branches where half a hundred spider webs gleam with collected dew among the still-green leaves.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Willow Tree Marsh
node.description: The land rises to the north where a line of massive willows sweeps the ground with their deep green fronds. As the land drops to the south, it becomes damp and marshy. Thick hummocks of drier ground hold clumps of tiny wild-flowers, giving a curiously lovely splash of color to the drab grey and brown of the scum-covered pools between them. A sea of mud to the south fades indistinctly into a sluggish brown river.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Willow Tree Marsh
node.description: A thin clump of willows grows on a relatively dry patch of higher ground surrounded by marshland. Heavy clumps of rushes grow around the edge of the dry land and somewhere among them something is moving carefully. A wading bird perhaps, in search of the numerous frogs who continually sound their varied notes on all sides.

node.name: Northwall Trail, Wooded Grove
node.description: A rhythmic chittering amid feathery patches of fern welcomes you to this grove. Tall wyndwood and oak trees, thickly cloaked in ivy, arch over a thin trail that bends around the town wall to the northeast. Like a puppeteer, the leafy canopy directs a dance of sunlight and shadow across the ground.

The rhythmic song of cicadas hums through the grove, welcoming the passerby's footfalls. The silvery eyes of night peer down through the rustling canopy overhead, illuminating the bare soil of a thin trail that bends around the town wall to the northeast.

node.name: Northwall Trail, Wooded Grove
node.description: The sweet smell of wildflowers carried on the breeze mingles with the spicy smell of cedar and juniper. Sunlight dapples the mossy ground in golden hues and glistens on the dew-laden petals of tiny snowflowers. A gnarled oak tree, cracked in two by a great tempest's fury, lays beside the trail.

The sweet smell of wildflowers carried on the breeze mingles with the spicy scent of cedar and juniper. At the sound of an owl, a startled woodmouse scurries across the trail toward a gnarled and broken oak tree.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Manor House Bedroom
node.description: This room is fitted out as a guest bedroom for overnight visitors. The bedding has long since rotted away leaving only the iron frame and some leather scraps that once formed the supports for the mattress. Scraps of cloth and bits of discolored ribbon show that perhaps a lady once dwelt here. A patch of blood-stained plaster on one wall shows you she did not enjoy her stay.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Manor House Linen Closet
node.description: A small storage area and workroom, this once held the supplies of linen such as sheets, blankets, towels and so on needed to keep people clean and rested. A hole in the roof has let in years of rain and snow and dirt. What is left of once crisp white sheets and warm woolen blankets is now an unspeakable mass of corruption and rot. There seems something in the very air of this place that causes decay far beyond what one might normally expect.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Manor House, Cellar Stairs
node.description: A narrow landing sits at the top of a rotted wooden staircase. Above you is a trapdoor and below you is only darkness and musty smells. You can make out a row of massive objects below but little else.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Manor House Wine Cellar
node.description: Dark and shadowed, the room extends a good ways under this part of the building. Huge casks stand in a row along the brick wall. One or two evidence some attack as they seem to have been gnawed on. But by and large, the casks seem intact. Thick cobwebs stretch between them and all along the walls. Dust and mold are heavy in the air as is the stink of rotting wine dregs. A shadowy arch leads deeper into the gloom.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Manor House, Cold Cellar
node.description: This room has a surprising chill to it. Used once for cold storage, it lies abandoned to rot and waste. You nearly trip over a moldering mess that was once a carcass of meat. Iron hooks hang from the roof and threaten to impale you if you are not careful. Once used to hang meat, they are rusty and many are coated with dried blood. Rotting sacks of root vegetables and grain lie about, apparently left behind and forgotten. They are ruined by the damp and time.

node.name: Wolf Clan Trader Outpost
node.description: This outpost is a miniature replica of one of the great Trader Guild buildings in the larger towns. Designed for rapid buying and selling of bulk goods by Guild members, it is crammed and jammed with crates, boxes and packages of all sizes and shapes. A harried Guild trade minister is at hand to expedite members' transactions and to make sure none of the goods leave under their own power or without the proper fees and monies being exchanged.

node.name: Applebrandy River, Eastern Riverbed
node.description: The Applebrandy flowed in this narrow, deep gorge at one point, plowing a passage that grew deeper through the years until its bed lay in cold shadows never touched by sunshine. But the river is gone now, and a coat of lush green grass almost as long and thick as bending seaweed covers the ground and walls alike.

node.name: Applebrandy River, Western Riverbed
node.description: Erosion along the crumbling bank threatens to erase the empty waterway. Dotting the sides, gritty silt and jagged furrows give evidence to the slow changing of the land. Meanwhile, shoots of grass, both fresh and from seasons past, break through the exposed earth in a seemingly futile attempt to fight the effects of time.

node.name: Applebrandy River, Eastern Riverbed
node.description: The riverbed stumbles through a series of wavy ruts bearing the accumulation of rich sediment over the passing years. Colorful calcified deposits cake the walls, narrowing and impeding passage still further. Far above, a family of knifewrens have made a nest on a small ledge, squawking cheerfully at nothing in particular.

node.name: Applebrandy River, Western Riverbed
node.description: Knee-high grasses span the width of the broad riverbed, creating the illusion of a smooth continuous flow as the stalks sway on the wind. A solitary boulder crests the pale green waves like the hump of an old tortoise's shell.

node.name: Applebrandy River, Eastern Riverbed
node.description: This area of the dried riverbed is choked with debris. Small sticks, sharp splinters of whitened bone and rusty weapons poke their treacherous teeth above the deep, luxuriant grass. The floor itself is notably higher in relation to the sloping walls. An overhanging ledge to the east lies within easy reach.

node.name: Applebrandy River, Western Riverbed
node.description: A stone wall looms over the bank, and rows of neatly tended trees grow beyond the barrier. Dank leaves, intermixed with an occasional shriveled brown rock, have created layers of composting materials upon the ground. Clinging to the wind, a faint smell of apples mixes with the aroma of wild grass and detritus filling the gorge.

node.name: Applebrandy River, Doline
node.description: Years of water flowing across the fertile ground eventually caused the soil to succumb to the weight of the world, creating a rather large sinkhole in the riverbed. The sides of the concave depression slope gently downward towards the middle, where the grassy floor evens out until rising again across the way.

node.name: Applebrandy River, Doline
node.description: Whenever the wind blows, the breeze swirls around inside the sinkhole and stirs the tall grasses like a mixed drink. Pebbles sporadically rain into the depression from the banks above, only to roll toward the middle and add to the collection of rock fragments already in place. Unlike the rest of the riverbed, the floor of the doline is somewhat softer due to the disintegrating bedrock beneath the thin layer of green.

node.name: Applebrandy River, Doline
node.description: Like a colossal bowl, the ground slants at a gentle gradient toward the center of the area, as if the earth was trying to swallow everything that brazenly adventures into the sinkhole. Chattering birds occasionally land on the awkward sticks jutting out over the sides of the sinkhole, only to be frightened away by the low, intermittent hissing from the grass below. The spindly green stalks flinch in spurts and jerks from hidden movement underneath.

node.name: Applebrandy River, Doline
node.description: Occasional shrieks from flying predators overhead echo all around in the deep sinkhole, filling the space with piercing avian cries of the hunt. The grass rises up from the rock-strewn ground like the hackles of a dog, tensed as if in response to the movement of creatures underfoot. Nature never lets silence exist for very long amongst the ever-present flora and fauna.

node.name: Ancient Tower, Exterior
node.description: The round base of a massive stone tower rests among the cracked rocks and rubble which have worked their way loose from brittle mortar and have fallen to rest at the great structure's feet. Silverleaf vines slink up from the dry soil and interweave to form a massive living wall, perhaps the only element bracing the ancient tower from collapsing into a heap of stones and dust. A gaping archway on the west side of the tower is all that remains of the wooden doorway which once hung there.

node.name: Ancient Tower, First Level
node.description: Long brilliant rays of light stream through stone cracks as wide as a barbarian's fist and bounce off the floating dust particles which choke the air and lie thick across the floor. Even the multitudinous spider webs which span from ceiling to wall to doorway are coated with a thick chalky layer. A steep spiralling stair is the single standing structure on this first level floor.

The chill night air creeps through stone cracks as wide as a barbarian's fist and fans the floating dust particles which choke the air and lie thick across the floor. Even the multitudinous spider webs which span from ceiling to wall to doorway are coated with a thick chalky layer. A steep spiralling stair is the single standing structure on this first level floor.

node.name: Ancient Tower, Stairwell
node.description: Chipped and broken stone steps spiral up and down the round interior of the ancient tower. Here and there along the walls gaps remain where mighty stone blocks have slipped from their mortar and fallen to the ground below. You also see some steps leading up and some stairs leading down.

node.name: Ancient Tower, Stairwell
node.description: Chipped and broken stone steps spiral up and down the round interior of the ancient tower. Here and there along the walls gaps remain where mighty stone blocks have slipped from their mortar and fallen to the ground below.

node.name: Ancient Tower, Stairwell
node.description: Chipped and broken stone steps spiral up and down the round interior of the ancient tower. Here and there along the walls gaps remain where mighty stone blocks have slipped from their mortar and fallen to the ground below.

node.name: Ancient Tower, Stairwell
node.description: Chipped and broken stone steps spiral up and down the round interior of the ancient tower. Here and there along the walls gaps remain where mighty stone blocks have slipped from their mortar and fallen to the ground below.

node.name: Ancient Tower, Stairwell
node.description: Chipped and broken stone steps spiral up and down the round interior of the ancient tower. Here and there along the walls gaps remain where mighty stone blocks have slipped from their mortar and fallen to the ground below.

node.name: Ancient Tower, Abandoned Workshop
node.description: Before continuing its up and downward spirals, the staircase breaks open onto a stone platform which may have served at one time as a magical workshop. Blackened walls, floor, and ceiling speak eloquently of a powerful magic gone awry and backfiring on its caster. The room is empty but for a single rosewood case, which stands as if left untouched by magic and time.

node.name: Ancient Tower, Open Air Shrine
node.description: The suppressive walls below give way to open air on this top level of the tower. Great stone columns steadfastly support a battered and weathered roof which has long since lost its shingles to the elements. The rotted remnants of wooden railings hang limply between columns, having lived out their usefulness years ago.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Wooded Area
node.description: The path winds between giant oaks mixed in with a secondary growth of smaller trees of many types. Your footsteps are hushed on a thick carpet of rotting leaves and pine needles. The air is fresh with the smell of growing things and rich earth. The only jarring note is an odd footprint in the dirt. Of some size, it seems almost human but for its far longer toes ending in deep indentations that speak of non-human claws.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Wooded Area
node.description: This small clearing is open to the sky but surrounded by a thick growth of trees. The ground here is soft and shows evidence of recent footsteps. There is a faint scent of burned wood and ash from the east while several other paths branch off in various directions. A tall, grotesque totem carved of ironwood dominates the center of the clearing.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Wooded Area
node.description: Something has bedded down here lately. A crude lean-to of branches stripped of their leaves sits in this tiny clearing. A torn and ruined backpack lies in front of the lean-to and several trees bear scorch marks as if they had been hit by a mage's fire spells. There is a faint scent of dried blood in the air and hundreds of large flies buzz about in morbid curiosity.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Wooded Area
node.description: The trees grow thick here and the air is heavy and still. Dried twigs and branches underfoot cause you to move carefully lest a snap give warning to things best left undisturbed. A partially-gnawed corpse of a small inkhorne deer hangs impaled upon a sharp upthrust branch. The stench of its corruption thickens the air with a sweetish, vile miasma.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Firepit
node.description: Carved benches of stone and wood circle a firepit in the center of this large clearing. Your nose tells you that there has been a fire here not too far in the past and a pile of cracked and charred bones suggests whatever lit the fire might not hesitate at taking a try at your own marrow. You suddenly realize this part of the woods is very quiet, no bird chirps nor does any breeze rustle the leaves. Crude standards depicting a clenched fist with rust-colored claws surround the clearing.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Woodlot
node.description: This is an open area, mostly bare of trees. It appears to have served as the woodlot for the manor as there are stumps everywhere and the ground is littered with scraps and splinters of wood. A large woodpile left long ago to dry, has become a tangled mess covered with vines and moss. Huge flat fungi sprout from the stacks of rotting logs.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Barren Spot
node.description: Near the protecting outer wall, the earth is barren for some reason. There is no sign of growth or tree and the soil is a hard and brittle thing with no life in it. The wall seems in surprisingly good shape. On this side at least, time has not worked any harm. Rising too tall to climb, it seems to have done its duty well in protecting this place.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Wooded Path
node.description: This path snakes between two close-set trees with low-hanging foliage. A perfect spot for an ambush, you note to yourself, while trying to stay to the center of the narrow path, away from the shadows and their feeling of watchful menace.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Wooded Path
node.description: The ground here is slightly damp and marshy underfoot. Several snails laboriously work their way across a large rock, leaving glistening trails of slime. An odd form of clinging vine has snaked around the trees here and there. Many heavy loops of it threaten to garrotte you as they dangle along your path among the dense greenery.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Wooded Marsh
node.description: The ground is low and swampy underfoot. Each step leaves an imprint in the soil that oozes moisture. There are heavy vines looped over everything and your footing is unsteady as you try to avoid tripping. Every bare patch of ground sprouts colonies of dead-white toadstools. From nearby you hear a deep croaking sound followed by several more in different directions until you stand in the midst of a chorus of frog calls.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Rocky Springs
node.description: Standing on relatively firm ground, you note a natural cairn of rocks from which a bubbling spring arises to flow down into the boggy ground south and west. A tiny pond has formed at the base of the rocks and little water-skimmer insects dart across its smooth surface, dodging each other like frantic ice skaters. There is a wild and untamed beauty here that earns your respect for whoever first laid out this abandonded park.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Marshy Path
node.description: Several willow trees grow close together, nearly choking off the pathway. Somewhere nearby you hear flowing water. Brightly colored flowers hang from thick-stemmed creepers along the tree trunks, while numerous dragonflies flit among them on jewelled wings. From time to time a shaft of light fights its way through the greenery and strikes the fliers' wings, causing their intense colors to glisten and sparkle.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Rock Outcrop
node.description: A large rock outcrop thrusts its way from beneath the boggy soil here, blocking all passage save back towards a nearby spring. The outcrop rises alongside the outer wall of the preserve but a series of downward- and upward-pointing spikes set near the top discourage any thoughts of rock-climbing today. Large patches of moss form abstract designs on the granite outcrop and one struggling tree has tried to make a home in a dirt-filled crack in the rock.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Stream
node.description: The path ends here at a small stream that sings softly to itself as it flows among mossy stones. Midges and gnats swarm above the water in clouds and they react to your presence with hungry delight. Looking north along the stream bed you see it flows from beneath a high stone wall. A tiny fish breaks the water's surface to snag a minute insect for supper.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Stream
node.description: The stream flows gently from north to south, running along an obviously artificial course. This place was once meant as a pleasant spot to sit and enjoy the sound, as there is an ancient stone bench, now overturned and broken, set along the stream's edge. A small hole in the stream bank appears to mark the home of a badger or some other water-dweller.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Stream
node.description: A stream widens out as it approaches a small river. The ground is soft and marshy and is heavy with reeds and sedge-grass. Frogs croak loudly along the banks and one occasionally leaps into the water with a loud splash.

node.name: Hunting Preserve, Willow Grove and Stream
node.description: The stream runs down into a small muddy river, hard by a large grove of willows growing in the rich soil. As they whisper to each other, long branches brushing the ground in a gentle breeze, it seems to you that there are words and meanings hidden in the idle sounds. Beneath your feet, the boggy ground shows traces of someone or something else passing by recently.

node.name: Northwall Trail, Wooded Grove
node.description: The sounds of the river splash through the trees from the southeast, where the woods end abruptly in a tangle of felled trees. The massive deadfall looks like the remains of some giant creature, its weather-bleached bones laying in a great heap beside the river.
The sounds of the river splash through the trees to the southeast, where the tangled trunks of a massive deadfall laying along the riverbank glow a ghostly pale in the moonlight.

node.name: Crossing, North Wall Battlements
node.description: Rounding the city's northwestern-most point, the cobbled walkway stretches a short distance before being interrupted by an unfinished section of the town wall. Although a stack of felled trees evidences the logging in progress, the forest is still perilously close to the new defenses and provides would-be attackers protective cover.

node.name: Crossing, West Gate Battlements
node.description: The fitted stone of the town walls intersects in a curved angle, one side becoming the western wall and the other stretching out against the northern border of the town. From this vantage point above the West Gate, a warrior can watch for enemies breaking from the cover of the northern forest or sweeping up from the grassy plains to the southwest.

node.name: Crossing, West Wall Battlements
node.description: The cobbled pavement atop the walkway crumbles into the unfinished wall as it stretches south toward the Segoltha River. The view over the wall of lush grassland and farms is a stark contrast to the sight of the slums and squalid buildings that line Kertigen Road.

node.name: Temple Hill, Neighborhood Entrance
node.description: A pair of stone pillars mark the edge of the neighborhood named Temple Hill. A freshly graded, crushed-stone street carries traffic south into the heart of the community. Running along one side of the lane, a low stone wall, cut with a prominent wrought iron gate, borders the grounds of Temple Hill Manor. Across the street are a row of neat stone cottages.

node.name: Temple Hill, Temple Hill Lane
node.description: The crushed stone of the lane leads between several stone cottages, winding its way deeper into the district. Young locust trees have been planted along both sides of the road in the hopes that with the passage of time they will shade the way.

node.name: Temple Hill Lane, Salvage Stoneworks
node.description: With lights dimmed for the night, somber cottages stand across from a large industrial workshop that dominates the south side of the lane. Just visible in the weak light behind the large building is a chute leading down from a quarry that lifts strange vertical shadows into the night sky.

Lazy clouds of dust occasionally billow out from a large stoneworking shop dominating the south side of Temple Hill Lane. Behind the workshop, loose rock and unprocessed rubble tumbles down a large chute from a partially visible quarrying area.

node.name: Temple Hill, Temple Hill Lane
node.description: Dark iron lanterns hung from tall poles glow softly against the darkness of night. A scattering of pots and vases leave shadows against the somber walls of the homes.

Carefully tended lawns and young trees provide evidence that the residents of this neighborhood are planting and planning for the future. Stone and brick cottages line the lane, with somber colors predominating -- mostly dark greys, dark browns, and dull reds, although the trimmings and trappings suggest the inhabitants are not nearly as gloomy as their dwellings.

node.name: Temple Hill, Temple Hill Lane
node.description: Lawns and gardens stretch out alongside stone cottages that stand in rows along the lane. Small trees and plantings decorate the well-tended lawns, but none are of any immense size. Evidently, the temple rubble provides better building material than soil for planting.

node.name: Temple Hill, Memorial Park
node.description: Grass surrounds a small reflecting pool in this wooded park at the top of the hill. Strategically placed low stone benches surround the pool, allowing peaceful contemplation of life. Roses twine along a fence that separates the park from the quarry to the east.

node.name: Temple Hill, Memorial Park
node.description: Jagged stone makes a staggered path through this restful park. Tall trees reach out to the sky and give homes to squirrels, rabbits and a variety of birds. A lone stone bench, flanked on each side by a pot of fragrant flowers, offers a place for quiet reflection.

node.name: Temple Hill, Temple Hill Lane
node.description: Brightly lit stone cottages throw light almost everywhere on the darkened street except for one rubble-strewn lot, leaving it in the shadows. An unusually sturdy fence, immediately noticeable even in the dim light, surrounds the area.

Cozy, sturdy white cottages line the crushed-stone street, with the exception of one cordoned-off lot. The fence surrounding it is quite sturdy, and has been patched and reinforced to prevent even the most agile of children from wandering into the area.

node.name: Temple Hill, Temple Hill Lane
node.description: Stolid cottages stand in the darkness of the crushed stone street bending around the hill. A cluster of lighted windows are visible downhill, backed by the shadowy mass of the city wall and the lights of the Crossing twinkling in the inky darkness beyond.

The street turns to follow the contour of Temple Hill, providing a good view from the high vantage point. Downhill lies a small court with a statue in the center. Rising behind it are the earthen ramparts of the Crossing, the roofs of the city peeking over the top of the wall.

node.name: Temple Hill, Battle Bell Court
node.description: Snuggled between trees, hills, and the city wall, the tranquil court rests quietly in the night. Graceful cottages cluster around a huge iron bell hung from a decorative stone tower. Candles carefully placed within the tower lend a soft warm glow to the bell within.

The clamor of commerce from around the West Gate carries from beyond the city wall, but this tranquil court is well screened from view among the trees. Graceful cottages cluster around a huge iron bell hung from a decorative stone tower.

node.name: Temple Hill, Temple Hill Lane
node.description: Carefully arranged cottages surround a stone pedestal topped by a glass case. The many lights of the Crossing glisten to the east, while a thoughtfully placed lantern highlights a bronze plaque and the contents of the glass case.

Cottages surround a simply carved stone pedestal in the center of the lane. A glass case surmounts the pedestal, with a bronze plaque mounted firmly on the front. Downhill to the east, a great expanse of rooftops stretches out behind the earthen mass of the Crossing city wall.

node.name: Temple Hill, Temple Hill Lane
node.description: Scents of cedar and pine drift upon the air, perhaps from the fires of the nearby homes. Soft rustlings of night creatures mingle with faint owl hoots and form a serene melody. To the east, the twinkling lights of Crossing contrast with the closer black bulk of the city wall.

Scents of fresh bread and baked goods drift upon the air, perhaps from one of the nearby homes. Sounds of children playing mingle with bird song and form a pleasant melody. The cozy cottages here have a sweeping view of the Crossing wall below with the city beyond.

node.name: Temple Hill, Captain's Court
node.description: A small pond in the middle of this quiet, restful court sports tiny boats upon its surface. Outdoor lanterns from the surrounding cottages give a nice, soft glow to the surrounding shrubs and flowers. Taller trees loom to the south as an occasional sleepy birdcall sounds in the darkness.

Laughter rings loud as children play with boats upon a small pond. Each cottage in this pleasant court faces the pond and has a different flag hung from its eaves. To the south grows a more densely wooded area that offers the children more exciting play.

node.name: Temple Hill, Hero's March
node.description: The low, yellowish vegetation of the lane gives way to deeper greens and larger shrubs, partially masking the gentle slope to the south. One young lunat tree seems to be thriving, although it still stands only about as tall as a Gor'Tog.

node.name: Temple Hill, Hero's March
node.description: The stately manors constructed high on Temple Hill enjoy a broad view of the Mycthengelde Flatlands and the roofs of the Crossing. The dense city lights of the Crossing create a dull glow overhead that contrasts notably with the scattered cottage lights along Finch Cottage Path down beyond a narrow stone path.

The stately manors constructed high on Temple Hill enjoy a broad view of the Mycthengelde Flatlands and the roofs of the Crossing. Rows of colorful flowers and shrubs encircle each manor and give them a distinctive look. A narrow stone path leads south towards Finch Cottage Path.

node.name: Temple Hill, Hero's March
node.description: Cheery glows emanate from the windows of stone cabins lining Hero's March, echoed by a small glimmer of lights from the Crossing to the east. A scattering of cabin lights twinkle to the south through the thick undergrowth.

Cottages lining the crushed rubble surface of Hero's March have expansive views of Finch Cottage Path and a tiny glimpse of the Crossing's western wall. Clusters of homes, visible as roofs and chimneys, poke through the lush vegetation below while birdsong drifts on the air.

node.name: Temple Hill, Hero's March
node.description: A heavy cast iron sundial is centered in the middle of the crushed stone path, a low dark shape in the dimness. Occasional gleams of light like bright gold shine from cottage windows or doors. Nearly invisible in the shadows between two cottages, a grassy path winds uphill.

A heavy cast iron sundial is centered in middle of the crushed stone path, surrounded by a narrow ring of low-growing herbs. Occasionally a bird swoops down to land on it, as if checking the time. Between two cottages, a grassy path winds uphill.

node.name: Temple Hill, Salvage Quarry
node.description: Piles of stone and pieces of machinery stand silently in the darkness. Along the west edge of the quarry the dust of the day's work has settled upon the machines in a thick layer opposite piles of sorted material. A cliff stands to the south, forming a tall backdrop to the scene.

Workers sort the salvaged stone of the quarry into piles of similar size and color. Along the west edge of the pit, stone is pounded and poured through stacked sieves to make various grades of sand and gravel. Finished materials are stacked along the side of the quarry until needed, when they are slid down a large chute to the stone works. Every few minutes, warning shouts precede a great tumbling of raw materials from a cliff to the south.

node.name: Temple Hill, Salvage Quarry
node.description: Tall stone faces loom above three sides of the quarry, standing stark in the night. Occasionally small stones slide down from the treacherous rock walls, echoing loudly as they reach the bottom and bounce over a low cliff.

Tall faces of variegated stone loom above the observer on three sides of the quarry. Workers pry mixed stone and rubble from these rock walls, sending it tumbling into piles which are then shoved over a small cliff to the north for sorting.

node.name: Temple Hill Manor, Grounds
node.description: Framed by a low stone wall pierced with a wrought iron gate, a grand lawn stretches out along three sides of Temple Hill Manor to gracefully encompass the elegant abode. Low plantings form dark hummocks on the lawn, and young trees throw thin dark shadows across the front of the manor. Two bronze statues set on stone pedestals hold places of honor on the great lawn.

Framed by a low stone wall pierced with a wrought iron gate, a grand lawn stretches out along three sides of Temple Hill Manor to gracefully encompass the elegant abode. Small plantings dot the grass, drawing attention toward the young maple trees flanking the door of the manor. Two bronze statues set on stone pedestals hold places of honor on the great lawn, further enhancing the elegant setting.

node.name: Temple Hill, Hero's March
node.description: The taller vegetation of the Mycthengelde Flatlands grows close against the hill below this stretch of Hero's March. Darkness and shadows create an illusion that the Mycthengelde treetops are but an extension of Temple Hill. Stone cottages cluster along the dark gravel of the street, their windows throwing a welcome light on the comforting scene.

The Mycthengelde Flatlands encroach upon the base of Temple Hill just below this stretch of Hero's March, with the tallest trees almost an extension of the hill. Stone cottages cluster along the gravel surface of the way, the solid houses and well-maintained street lending a sense of permanence to the area. Children shout as they sport among the cottages, their noises echoed by the noise of stone falling in a nearby quarry.

node.name: Temple Hill, Hero's March
node.description: Low plantings form lines and odd geometric figures on the lawns that surround the gaily lit stone cottages. A few raised beds sport taller varieties of vegetation that draw thick shadows around them in the embrace of the night.

Yellowish-green lawns and shrubs stretch in front of cozy stone cottages, green only where the owners have imported soil or planted raised beds. In spite of the yellow color, the residents of this area are enthusiastic gardeners as shown by the attention to their landscaping.

node.name: Temple Hill, Hero's March
node.description: A broad view of the Mycthengelde Flatlands looms emptily to the west, fading into the dark night. Pristine cottages face a tall marble fountain whose surface is lit by carefully placed lamps. Thick shrubs and pale flowers rustle in the breeze and send fragrant scents into the air.

Pristine cottages line each side of the path and enjoy a pleasant view of a tall marble fountain and the surrounding flatlands. A memorial plaque upon the fountain hails warriors from seasons past. Thick shrubs and pale flowers grace each home with sweet smells and a touch of elegance.

node.name: Temple Hill, Hero's March
node.description: Colorful cottages line the crushed rock street and enjoy a panoramic view of the Mycthengelde Flatlands. Young trees, freshly planted, lift up their scrawny limbs to the sky. One such tree enjoys a ragtag doll hanging haphazardly from its highest point.

Pristine cottages line each side of the path and enjoy a pleasant view of a tall marble fountain and the surrounding flatlands. A memorial plaque upon the fountain hails warriors from seasons past. Thick shrubs and pale flowers grace each home with sweet smells and a touch of elegance.

node.name: Temple Hill, Finch Cottage Path
node.description: Finch Cottage Path represents a drastic change from Temple Hill proper. The soil is old and deep here, and vegetation flourishes. Care was taken when building the cottages to leave as many of the original plants as possible. The occasional ruffle of feathers reveals the presence of a flock of birds roosting for the night in the thick shrubbery of the area.

Finch Cottage Path represents a drastic change from Temple Hill proper. The soil is old and deep here, and vegetation flourishes. Care was taken when building the cottages to leave as many of the original plants as possible. Numerous songbirds flit and chirp among the abundant shrubs and trees, a living reward for the careful preservation of plants.

node.name: Temple Hill, Finch Cottage Path
node.description: Soft breezes carry over a wide tan circle of crushed stone and slip into the surrounding wyndwood trees, producing a soothing music of rustling leaves as they pass. Snug cottages tuck themselves beneath the tangled tree limbs that lean in over the circle. A platform birdfeeder on a tall pole in the middle of the circle stands lonesome in the night, waiting for birds to arrive with the dawn.

A number of paths converge upon a wide tan circle of crushed stone surrounded by twisting wyndwood trees. Snug cottages tuck themselves beneath the tangled tree limbs that reach out over the circle. Birds dart about from tree to bush to shrub, pausing frequently at the cedar platform birdfeeder on a tall pole that stands at the center of the circle.

node.name: Temple Hill, Pine Finch Circle
node.description: The path ends in a dim grove of trees with scattered lights originating from a small circle of cottages centered about a tall cedar platform birdfeeder. The cottages are nestled beneath the canopies of tall old trees and almost disappear into shadows of the trees behind luxuriant stands of low plants. Soft, irregular sounds disclose the presence of birds hidden for the night in the thick undergrowth.

The path ends in a grove of trees containing a small circle of cottages centered about a tall cedar platform birdfeeder. The cottages are nestled beneath the canopies of tall old trees and surrounded by luxuriant stands of low plants. Birds sprint from place to place in a flurry of wings, pausing from time to time at the birdfeeder.

node.name: Temple Hill, Finch Cottage Path
node.description: Lunat trees loom tall and shadowy over the path meandering between the warmly lit cottages snugly situated in thick stands of shrubs. The tree-lined path continues to the south, while a smaller path branches off to the northwest. The dense shrubbery emits an occasional drowsy chirp that hints at the notable avian population of the area.

Lunat trees line the elegant path meandering between the comfortable-looking cottages snugly situated in thick stands of shrubs. The tree-lined path continues to the south, while a smaller path branches off to the northwest. Birds dart between shrubs and trees, while birdsong rings out in a near-constant flow of music.

node.name: Temple Hill, Goldfinch Circle
node.description: The path dead-ends into a cozy circle of homes throwing warm light through their windows into a small clearing. Cottages nearly disappear in thick growths of native plants and the landscaping gathers odd shadows in the dim light. A cedar platform birdfeeder stands on a tall pole in the middle of the clearing, bereft of winged visitors by night.

The path dead-ends into a cozy circle of homes clustered around a small clearing edged with wildflowers. Comfortable cottages are nestled among native plants and lush landscaping tended with loving care. Birds flit about the luxurious vegetation, pausing at a cedar platform birdfeeder on a tall pole.

node.name: Temple Hill, Finch Cottage Path
node.description: The graceful path winds among cheerily lit stone cottages nestled in thickets of vegetation. One notable oak stands paternally near the path, a tall feeder hanging from its branches just visible in the dim light thrown out by the homes.

The graceful path winds between stone cottages nestled in comforting thickets of vegetation. Chirping echoes around the cottages as birds dart in and out amongst the shrubs. A long sunflower feeder hangs from a sprawling old oak, providing a royal feast for visiting birds.

node.name: Temple Hill, House Finch Circle
node.description: Tall shrubs and heavy vegetation grow in lush profusion around cozy stone cottages set in a rough circle. Light from the cabin windows coalesces upon a large birdfeeder on a tall pole -- evidently the local entertainment.

Native plants and bird-friendly vegetation grow in lush profusion around cozy stone cottages. A large oak birdfeeder on a tall pole creates a focus for the cabins -- evidently bird watching is a common local interest.

node.name: Temple Hill, Finch Cottage Path
node.description: Lunat trees cast long shadows over the path that narrows as it continues toward the southwest, slipping between cozy cottages pleasantly located in stands of tended vegetation. A faint sound from the surrounding undergrowth provides evidence of the noteworthy number of birds found in the neighborhood.

Lunat trees line the elegant path that narrows as it continues toward the southwest, slipping between cozy cottages pleasantly located in stands of tended vegetation. Birds gambol in the air between trees on either side of the path and birdcalls ring out with a merry chatter from the surrounding undergrowth.

node.name: Temple Hill, Finch Cottage Grounds
node.description: Tall shrubbery dominates the landscaping around Finch Cottage, appearing denser in the dark. Occasionally, rustling sounds and the rare sleepy birdcalls can be heard coming from the bushes. A long feeder hangs in front of one window, waiting for birds to arrive with the dawn.

The Finch Cottage grounds are carefully landscaped to attract birds. Shrubs and berry bushes provide food and sanctuary, and nest boxes hung about the yard provide cozy homes. Finches abound, attracted to a long hanging feeder in front of the cottage's window.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: Small, bent satinwoods cling to the rocky slope, their gnarled roots seeking patches of soil. Tiny purple flowers spread across the ground, thriving and flourishing where the larger and greedier trees barely hang on. A path levels out to the northwest, following the curve of the outcrop, while to the southwest the way continues on up.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A huge rocky outcrop breaks through the thick, loamy soil of the forest as the ground rises and roughens. Fewer trees grow up here, and those that do cling to what soil they can find are smaller and twisted. Graceful ferns and lacy grey moss spread across the exposed rocks, softening their harsh outlines.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A narrow stony shelf runs along one edge of the rocky outcrop, winding among boulders and gaps and the occasional stunted tree. The view down to the east is green, a dense tree canopy only a short distance below. Small grey birds dart back and forth between the trees, quarreling over something.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A gnarled satinwood tree grows jammed into a shadowy corner, its stunted branches reaching up to the sky. Ferns rustle in the cold night breeze, punctuated by the call of a distant bird hunting somewhere in the blackness.

A gnarled satinwood grows jammed into a rocky corner, its stunted branches reaching up out of the shadow, seeking the sun. Yellowish ferns carpet the ground wherever a patch of soil lies, in crevices around the bare grey rocks.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A tangle of trees and shrubs growing in a deep patch of soil forces the path dangerously near the ledge to the east. The rocky outcrop drops away, giving a view of a vast, dense forest. Opposite the ledge, the rock rises up high overhead, the grey stone climbable only by spreading lichen and moss.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: Millenia of streaming rain have cut vertical grooves into the solid rock of the outcrop. Looking like the scored bark of some huge grey tree, the grooved stone runs down the rock face into a shadowy hollow.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A cool breeze blows past the rocky outcrop and up the slope to the west. Between the breeze and the perpetual shade here on the north side, it's rather chilly. The trees don't seem to mind, though, nor do the scrubby bushes that cling to the rocky soil.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: The footing is treacherous here on this particularly steep stretch of winding path. The trail turns south as it climbs higher, while the lower reaches are down to the east. Not even bushes grow in this immediate area -- all is steep cliff and featureless rock, with a narrow trail made even more harrowing by gusting winds.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A few stunted satinwood trees grow in the shallow soil up here on the outcrop. Yellow-green grass and a few thornbushes fill in the space between the trees. The bushes occasionally emit a rustling which isn't the product of the stiff breeze -- apparently some sort of small animal makes its home in this area, in whatever cover it can find.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A deeper patch of soil is home to a stand of lush bushes with ruffled blue flowers the size of an orange. Small paw prints lead in and out of the bushes, with an occasional larger paw print showing that predators live here too. Scruffy looking weeds grow in the rocky soil a distance from the bushes, and very little at all grows up the trail to the west, higher on the outcrop.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: This arm of the trail is wide and relatively flat, running between the northern and southern domes of the rocky outcrop. Tough grass grows all about, and some bushes and an occasional satinwood tree grow here and there about the landscape. The soil isn't very deep, nor very fertile, and the satinwoods aren't the healthiest specimens, but they persevere, as life always does, and they manage to survive the harsh conditions.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: The northern lobe of the outcrop rises high above, even though this intersection itself is nowhere near ground level. A spindly looking satinwood tree grows on the slope below and to the east, blocking most of the view in that direction. No birds flutter in its branches -- the only creatures immediately visible on the tree are some black ants, marching in a line along one of its nearer limbs. Some large claw marks in the bark suggest that larger animals are about, however.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: The two mounds of the rocky outcropping cast deep shadows on this narrow gap hardly any light penetrates, even from the stars. A few ferns and a scrubby bush rustle in the breeze.

Little light penetrates this narrow gap between the two mounds of the outcropping. Grey rock soars toward the sky to the north and south, with a deep, treacherous looking crevasse in between to the immediate south of the trail. A few sickly ferns grow in gaps and chinks in the rock, and a scrubby bush with poisonous looking berries clings to one side of the slope.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: Piles of rubble indicate frequent rockslides on this side of the outcrop. The loose boulders and rocks and pebbles make footing treacherous. A narrow trail leads the eye up and to the northeast, toward the ridge crest. Silhouetted trees whip back and forth in what appear to be strong winds.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: Coarse vines like grey-green twine cling to what little soil is to be found in hollows and chinks of the rock. Fireflies swirl and swoop in glowing spirals over the night-darkened vegetation, striving to attract mates with their luminous dance while at the same time avoiding night-hunting predators.

Tiny star-shaped flowers in purple and yellow dot coarse vines that cling, like grey-green twine, to what little soil is to be found in hollows and chinks of the rock. A few hearty insects, always thriving wherever there's even a ghost of life, march among the flowers. Some collect pollen or nectar, while others prey upon their neighbors.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: The trail winds around this northern lobe of the rocky outcrop, and a smaller path makes its way up to the eastern ridge. Low bushes with grey-green leaves grow here and there on the slope, finding whatever pockets of soil there may be. Occasional rustling sounds from the bushes suggest some sort of animal life, although if there are any small creatures here, they stay well hidden.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A pile of white bones and a few shreds of rotting hide suggest that something had a good meal not too long ago. A scrap of what looks like a hare's ear lies to one side, and the bones are about the right size to have been a hare. Large paw prints cover the ground around the carcass, but they're too overlapped to show where the predator went.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: The view to the northwest is grand at this elevation, with the landscape spread out like a patchwork quilt. An eagle soars in the distance, keeping a sharp eye out for prey on the distant ground. Closer in, the path curves east and west around the boundary of the rocky outcrop. Sea level is far below, and most of the surfaces within immediate reach are vertical.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: Stringy creepers spread out across the rock like a fisherman's net spread to dry. Ragged bell-shaped blossoms in a pale yellow decorate the vines, their petals glowing in the starlight. Fireflies swirl and dance above the flowers, leaving glowing afterimages in the blackness. Down in the dry dirt among the creepers is a large paw print, suggesting that creatures larger than fireflies do frequent this place.

Stringy creepers spread out across the rock like a fisherman's net spread to dry. Ragged bell-shaped blossoms in a pale yellow decorate the vines, their faces turned up to the sun like little cups. A dull yellow butterfly flutters from one flower to the next, collecting what little nectar they manage to produce. Down in the dry dirt among the creepers is a large paw print, suggesting that creatures larger than butterflies do frequent this place.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: The path runs straight north and south here, scoured clean of dirt by the gusting wind. A narrower trail, out of the wind but rough with loose stones, winds its way down the slope to the east. Farther east and much closer to the ground, a deep green forest spreads across the land. Farther yet, beyond the forest, are the regular, colored patches that mark croplands. A tiny village is barely discernable as an irregular blotch in the rectangular blocks of fieldland.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop, Ridge
node.description: An intrepid bird has made a nest high up in one of the stunted trees. The nest is a marvel of engineering, clinging to the branches with grass and vines and mud-plaster. That it's survived the steady, strong winds way up here speaks well of the stubborn bird who built it.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop, Ridge
node.description: Wind-blown grit has sculpted the stone into fanciful shapes, scouring out the softer stone and leaving the harder layers ridged and twisted. One spire looks rather like a chess piece, from the right angle.

Wind-blown grit has sculpted the stone into fanciful shapes, scouring out the softer stone and leaving the harder layers ridged and twisted. One spire looks rather like a chess piece from the right angle.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop, Ridge
node.description: The winds whip through the branches of the short, stunted trees up here on the ridge line. It's uncomfortably cold, and eyes watering from the wind can't even properly appreciate the view. Footing is good, since the wind has blown away loose stones and soil, leaving only what is well-anchored.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop, Slope
node.description: The slope on this side of the outcrop is just barely navigable, about down to here. The drop-off farther to the west is vertical, and the thought of climbing down it is unpleasant. The view is spectacular, however, and the western lands spread out from one horizon to the other are awe-inspiring in their beauty and variety.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop, Notch
node.description: This narrow notch between two huge rocks is home to nothing more complex than some yellowish grass and a bit of lacy grey moss that blends nearly invisibly into the stone. Little light penetrates here, and the atmosphere is bare and gloomy. The only positive note about this place is that the same rocks which shade it also block the winds.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop, Shaded Hollow
node.description: Lush green ferns line this hollow in the rock. The soil is thicker here, with the dry bed of a tiny stream, probably carved by flowing rain water, running down from above and disappearing into a dry, cracked basin. Towering stone rises high overhead in every direction, making this hollow uncomfortably cool even though it's protected from the wind.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: The view to the east, of lush, green forest and a glistening brook, is a sharp contrast to the harsher landscape in the immediate area. The deep, fertile soil of the forest is only a wish up here, where the ground is rocky and dry, with little loam in it. Plants are smaller, tougher, and less colorful than down on the flatlands.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: The trail west leads up, higher onto the outcrop. The breeze down here is cool and strong, but the branches of trees further up whip back and forth as though possessed by demons. Just looking up at it makes one feel cold. A smaller trail leading down to the southwest looks treacherous, but at least it doesn't look quite so chilly down there.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop, Crumbly Ledge
node.description: This ledge feels like it's about to fall off the rock face at any time. Tough grass grows in the soil captured by cracks in the rock, and the roots of the plants pry, very slowly, at the stone, forcing it farther and farther apart. Some day it'll give, and the ledge, and anything -- or any one -- on it will plunge down onto the flatlands below.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: The wind up here finds every gap and chink in clothing, armor, and anything else one might wrap up in. The plant life, at least, doesn't seem to mind and other plants grow low to the ground. No extravagant explosions of leaf or flower here -- everything is small, sturdy, and functional.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A wide spot in the trail invites a rest, and a clear view to the east invites a long, admiring look. A verdant forest spreads out immediately below the rocky outcrop, stitched with the narrow thread of a glittering brook across its middle. Beyond the forest lies cropland, planted in greens and browns and beiges, laid out like a game board. A small village lies far to the east, nestled among the fields and orchards.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A patch of white puffy flowers spreads out across the ground, their dark green tendrils seeking out soil and water. One mound of flowers looks like it's been chewed on, and some small paw prints in the dirt confirm the impression.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A crooked intersection in the trail splits the way into three branches. A flat path runs east, and seems to be the easiest way to go. A narrower trail winds up the side of the outcrop to the south, while a gap between a couple of rocks to the southwest leads down into shadow. The ground here is scoured clean of soil by the winds, and there are no tracks to indicate which path might be the more heavily travelled.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: The steep trail takes a turn here, curving from the north to the southwest as it climbs. Loose rock and pebbles make the footing uncertain, requiring complete concentration. An occasional howling cry, blasting through the cold air, makes concentration difficult, however.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: The trail winds around a slab of grey rock that thrusts into the air like a watchtower. The winds are sharp this high up, slicing like frozen knives into every chink and opening in clothing or armor. The only plants are low-growing, strongly rooted, or both.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: Looking down from the crest of the rocky outcrop, the change of terrain between the rocks and the forest is obvious. The dominant color on this side is grey -- grey rocks and grey-green foliage, spotted with occasional patches of dusty color where ever a plant has decided to put up flowers. On the forest side the dominant color is a rich green, where lush trees and grass and ferns blend with larger and more colorful flowers.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A patch of low thornbushes crowns the rock at the base of a taller spire. Sheltered somewhat from the wind, the bushes have managed to spread out and grow to about waist high. Despite the lack of wind on this side of the spire, however, the bushes sway and rustle -- apparently something else has also taken advantage of the calmer air and the shelter of the foliage.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: The biting winds draw tears to the eyes, but the view to the east is worth some discomfort. Directly below stands a lush forest, spread out like a deep green ribbon with a silver thread of water running through it. Patches of fields and orchards stretch from the edge of the wood to the eastern horizon, marred only by a tiny blotch of town. Far to the east, the smoke from dozens, or perhaps even hundreds of fires rises into the air, forming a foggy haze.

Strong winds howl through the blackness of the night, finding unimagined gaps in clothing and armor. Spread to the east is only more blackness, but lit by a few lights, here and there. One is relatively close, east and a bit south, a small flicker indicating a band or perhaps a small village. Slightly larger is the flickering glow from farther east, about halfway from here to the horizon. And on the horizon itself is a spot that lights up a patch of land as broad as an outstretched hand.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: Tiny purple flowers cover the rocky summit. Their mossy green foliage grows low to the ground, their roots digging in deep in search of both water and anchorage. A few patches of the mossy plants look crushed or nibbled, but no loose soil is allowed to collect here, and there are no tracks to indicate what might have been browsing.

node.name: Rocky Outcrop
node.description: A single gnarled satinwood stands here, bent and twisted by the wind until it resembles nothing so much as a gnarled hand growing out of the rocky soil, all its fingers yearning toward the west. A few low, mossy plants cling to its roots, sending up tiny purple flowers a bare fingerwidth above the ground.

node.name: Siergelde's Meek
node.description: Large rocks lie here and there, partially buried in the moist soil. Dense foliage grows low to the ground, covered with tiny droplets of condensation. A deep red vine clings to tree trunks, its tiny yellow blossoms giving off a pungent aroma.

node.name: Mycthengelde, Flatlands
node.description: The ground is inclined here at the foot of the Siergelde. The trail becomes indistinguishable as it disappears between low-growing shrubs and a thick grove of trees. To the north, the trees give way to grassy plains.

node.name: Siergelde's Meek
node.description: You pick your way cautiously over the rocky floor of the forest grove. A warm dampness swirls about you, causing your clothes to stick to your skin. You notice that the trunks of the trees grow closer here, their entwined branches all but blotting out the sky. While it is difficult to see very far in any direction, you can discern some light to the northeast.

node.name: Siergelde's Meek
node.description: The ground is rocky and uneven as it rises up the base of the Siergelde. Large insects bred in the moist earth buzz about your feet and near your face as you move cautiously through the darkness. A faint shimmer of light dances like a mirage to the southwest.

node.name: Siergelde's Meek
node.description: Moss clings heavily to the tree trunks and rocks within this forest grove. The ground is springy beneath your feet as you make your way through the near darkness. You can hear the occasional screech of a ringed owl breaking through the thick air, mingled with the constant buzz of insects. The trees appear to thin to the southwest.

node.name: Siergelde's Meek
node.description: A heavy breeze stirs the canopy of the forest grove, and the parted branches reveal patches of sky. Freshly-fallen leaves mix with damp soil to create a pleasant, earthy scent.

node.name: Siergelde's Regard
node.description: Here at the base of the Siergelde, a sheer drop of exposed rock rises from the thick forest grove. Soft light filters through the open air between the rockface and the canopy of the grove, causing the rock to glisten as if flecked with tiny pieces of glass. A cool, wispy breeze occasionally wends by, breaking the humidity.

Here at the base of the Siergelde, a sheer drop of exposed rock rises from the thick forest grove. Soft moonlight filters through the open air between the rockface and the canopy of the grove, causing the rock to glisten as if flecked with tiny pieces of glass. A cool, wispy breeze occasionally wends by, breaking the humidity.

node.name: Siergelde's Regard
node.description: Your breath catches in your throat as you make your way carefully along the steep rockface. An occasional bromeliad peeks out from a narrow crevice, its bright color commanding your attention.

node.name: Siergelde's Regard
node.description: The view from this point of the rocky incline is awe-inspiring. Beyond the treetops of the forest which skirts the hillside, you can see grassy plains spreading east to west, and far to the north, another forested area that appears to follow a high town wall. The air is particularly crisp, as if charged with energy.

node.name: Siergelde's Regard
node.description: Light green grasses envelope the hillside, which rises sharply to its top from where you stand. Little tufts of white, spindly flowers wave back and forth in the breeze like flimsy porcelain bells. Dark stones seem to peek at you from around the hill, and a worn trail has been deeply cut along the sharp incline to the summit.

node.name: Siergelde's Regard
node.description: A gentle bluff provides a restful place to breathe the sweet, clean air of the hillside. Far beyond the trees that mark the perimeter of the town walls to the north, you can see jagged peaks jutting into thick bands of clouds at the horizon.

node.name: Siergelde's Regard
node.description: The remnant of an incredible building surrounds the summit of the hill. Two great juniper trees grow straight into the sky on either side of a massive archway that stretches across the width of the trail. Through the archway, you can see that some of the original architecture remains standing, though most of the outer walls of the building have crumbled to nothing. A stillness broken only by the whisper of the wind envelopes the area.

node.name: Siergelde, Ruins
node.description: A carpet of thick rolling grasses is punctuated by tiny lavender flowers in what looks to be the foyer of the building. A great monolith of speckled granite towers above you, its midsection etched with images. Sparse tufts of juriweed skirt the point where the monolith has been driven into the ground by a power greater than any you can imagine.

node.name: Siergelde, Ruins
node.description: A jagged stone has fallen from the top of the ruin walls and lies in the center of a massive arch. A clump of juriweed has rooted beneath it, sending long spindly stems out in all directions. Through the archway, you can clearly see the grasslands below, hemmed at the horizon by a thickly-wooded forest. You notice there is little sound save the whisper of the wind.

node.name: Siergelde, Ruins
node.description: A large statue rises from the midst of a short crop of bushes near a crumbling archway. Clinging vines rooted deeply in the ancient mortar snake their way up the massive column stones, straining to reach the ornate architrave. Upon the architrave are carved various fruits, flowers and grains which surround a weathered brass plaque. The short, sweet song of a meadow lark reaches your ears, breaking the deep silence.

node.name: Siergelde, Ruins
node.description: A collapsed retaining wall of dark stones provides stark contrast to the lush green grasses. Light filters through ragged cracks in the wall, creating a lacy shadow on the ground. Part of a crumbled frieze lies nearby, upon which sits a weather-worn statuette. Through a west-facing archway, you can see a tiny grove of trees standing serenely near what seems to be a broken monolith.

node.name: Siergelde, Ruins
node.description: A sparse grove of trees stands just beyond an elliptical arch in the ruins. Abutting the trees are two massive black stones, each as long as a two-story building is high. They lie crookedly in the grass, overlapping each other like two snuggling giants. This broken monolith once stood as a single piece, a mighty landmark that would have been visible from the grassland below. On closer inspection, you note there are images painted on them.

node.name: Siergelde, Ruins
node.description: Bright buttercups grow in tight patches along this edge of the ruin. A support column has collapsed, tumbling the massive building stones into a great pile. In front of this pile are three jagged rocks driven partially into the ground, forming a semi-circle. Some previous visitor has painted images and symbols upon these rocks in a white, chalky substance that has nearly worn away.

node.name: Siergelde, Ruins
node.description: Chips of white granite are strewn across the hillside, mixed with the dark stones of the ruins. A large section of a carved architrave lies on the grass, overgrown with woodrose vines and worn by the elements. Here and there, a patch of wildflowers has taken root among the stones.

node.name: Siergelde, Ruins
node.description: The gentle slope of the hillside is littered with dark, well-hewn stones and tiny lavender flowers. A massive sculpture appears to sink at an angle into the ground, surrounded by tufts of wildflowers. From this vantage point, you can see the canopy of the forest which skirts the base of this hill. A gentle breeze envelopes you, instilling a sense of peace and tranquility.

node.name: Siergelde, Stone Grotto
node.description: Some of the building stones from the ruins that surround you have been fashioned into a shallow grotto at the very top of this hill. Within the grotto, four rounded stones of descending size are set one upon the other in the manner of a crude altar. At the foot of this altar, you find fruits and flowers in various stages of decay, the remnants of offerings to whatever power pervades this quietly sacred site.

node.name: Siergelde, High Path
node.description: The lush grass of the hillside gives way to rockier terrain as this meandering dirt path approaches what looks like open air. Though a thick copse obscures the view in the westward direction, a vista of browns and greens spreads onward to the west, sometimes accented by a touch of crimson the further it stretches.

node.name: Siergelde Cliffs, High Path
node.description: Chill wind whips from the bluffs below this ancient path, which is overgrown with weeds and pitted with holes. Hugging desperately at the very edge of the cliff, the pebbled walkway provides an incredible view of the lands far below -- lush, green and inviting, stretching for miles. Something akin to the song of a thrush drifts liltingly by.

Chill wind whips from the bluffs below this ancient path, which is overgrown with weeds and pitted with holes. Desperately hugging the edge of the cliff, the pebbled walkway wends along with no hint of beginning or end. Only a stark black border, where all the stars have fled, marks the land which stretches on and on, far below the rambling precipice.

node.name: Siergelde Cliffs, High Path
node.description: Loose pebbles fall away from the cliff to click and clack until they reach the obscurity of the world below. While the rest of the promontory is carpeted by flat grasses, the trodden seam is home to rugged tufts of juriweed. These hearty plants grow in forms suggesting dancers twirling merrily in fancy skirts.

node.name: Siergelde Cliffs, High Path
node.description: A slight dip in the path signals a narrowing of the trail. The land tilts steeply toward the empty air, and is traversable only with extreme caution. Further south, it turns sharply and seems to disappear.

node.name: Siergelde Cliffs, High Path
node.description: From this vantage point, the deep crimson walls of the cliffs are visible as they plummet to the land below. Their delicate, chalky appearance offers little confidence to those who prefer firmer ground. Deep, vertical ruts give the impression of these cliffs being forced up from the world below, by an impressively strong -- or extremely angry -- godlike being.

node.name: Siergelde Cliffs, High Path
node.description: A large boulder with a massive crack through its middle, sits at this bend in the path. The horrifying thing about it is that each mighty surge of wind sets it to shimmying ever so slightly. It is unclear how many years this ungainly thing has perched in this place, and it is equally unclear where it came from, since its sparkling obsidian exterior looks nothing like the remainder of the area.

node.name: Siergelde Cliffs, High Path
node.description: Large chunks of path have slipped a few inches down the cliff, and the only things holding them in place are the weeds. As the cliff inclines, a ledge of rock forms between the pathway and the void beyond, and the ground is interspersed with cheerful yellow dirdel.

node.name: Siergelde Cliffs, High Path
node.description: A dead tree juts out of the ledge along the cliff, its lifeless form suspended by its complex root system. Wind, screeching up toward the path, sets it to bobbing now and again, making it seem like its gnarled lower branch is pointing insistently at the land below.

node.name: Siergelde Cliffs, High Path
node.description: An abrupt change in land level forces one to climb in order to make further progress. Chalky red dirt flies loosely in the wind, settling thickly on exposed skin and clothing.

node.name: Siergelde Cliffs, High Path
node.description: Southward, the landscape is crossed by a sharply twisting ribbon of eroded soil which is the remnant of a primeval river. Its curves snake dangerously close to the edge of the cliffs before they disappear completely in a far-off forest. To the north, by contrast, all one can see is grassland sitting upon the deep red chalk of the cliff's face.

node.name: Siergelde Cliffs, Meander
node.description: The deep grasses which line this portion of the cliff's only trail are heavily trodden but nontheless resilient. Their bruised blades follow the course of the dried-up river as it cuts its way along the cliff.

node.name: Siergelde Cliffs, Meander
node.description: The riverbed continues its lazy maneuver over the landscape at the cliff's edge. Clipped grasses spread along the outer edge of the path, but everything adjacent to the riverbed is dry and dusty.

node.name: Siergelde Cliffs, Meander
node.description: The riverbed continues its lazy maneuver over the landscape at the cliff's edge. Clipped grasses spread along the outer edge of the path, but everything adjacent to the riverbed is dry and dusty.
